titles.text: Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind, Parallel Group, Dose-finding Phase 2 Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of BAY2433334 in Patients Following an Acute Non-cardioembolic Ischemic Stroke

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN01
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participant must be 45 years of age and older at the time of signing the informed consent Type of Participant and Disease Characteristics

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN02
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Non-cardioembolic ischemic stroke with

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN03
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: persistent signs and symptoms of stroke lasting for ≥ 24 hours OR

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN04
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: acute brain infarction documented by computed tomography (CT) or MRI AND

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN05
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: with the intention to be treated with antiplatelet therapy during the study conduct

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN06
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Imaging of brain (CT or MRI) ruling out hemorrhagic stroke or another pathology that could explain symptoms (e.g. brain tumor, abscess, vascular malformation)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN07
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Severity of index event nearest the time of randomization:

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN08
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Part A: minor stroke (defined as NIHSS ≤ 7) can be enrolled

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN09
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Part B: participants with minor or moderate stroke and NIHSS ≤ 15 can be enrolled. Participants undergoing thrombolysis or endovascular therapy (mechanical thrombectomy) can be enrolled but at the...

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN10
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Randomization within 48 hours after the onset of symptoms of the index event (or after patients were last known to be without symptoms in case of wake-up stroke)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN11
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Ability to conduct an MRI either before randomization or within 72 hours after randomization Informed Consent

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IN12
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Capable of giving signed informed consent which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the informed consent form (ICF) and in this protocol. Written informed consent...

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX01
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Prior ischemic stroke within last 30 days of index event

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX02
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of atrial fibrillation* or suspicion of cardioembolic source of stroke (*12-lead ECG or documented during cardiac rhythm monitoring)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX03
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Dysphagia with inability to safely swallow study medication at time of randomization

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX04
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Contraindication to perform brain MRI (e.g. certain types of aneurysm clips, claustrophobia, patients that cannot lie supine for 30 minutes, patients whose body structure exceeds the restrictions...

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX05
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Part A only: thrombolysis or endovascular therapy (mechanical thrombectomy) performed for index event

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX06
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Uncontrolled hypertension (systolic blood pressure ≥ 160 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure ≥ 100 mmHg) at randomization

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX07
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active bleeding; known bleeding disorder, history of major bleeding (intracranial, retroperitoneal, intraocular) or clinically significant gastrointestinal bleeding within last 6 months of randomization

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX08
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known significant liver disease (e.g. acute hepatitis, chronic active hepatitis, cirrhosis) or hepatic insufficiency classified as Child-Pugh B or C, or ALT or AST > 2.5 x the upper limit,...

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX09
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) < 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 calculated by Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD), determined between enrollment and randomization.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX10
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Major surgery during last 30 days or planned major surgery or intervention within study period (e.g. Carotid endarterectomy, CABG)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX11
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known allergy, intolerance or hypersensitivity to the study intervention (active substance or excipients). Prior/Concomitant Therapy

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX12
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Planned use or requirement of full dose and long term anticoagulation therapy during study conduct

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX13
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Anticipated need for chronic (more than 4 weeks) therapy with NSAIDs

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX14
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Concomitant use of any of the following therapies within 14 days (or at least five halflives of the active substance whatever is longer) before randomization and first study intervention administration:

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX15
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Strong inhibitors of cytochrome P450 isoenzyme 3A4 (CYP3A4) e.g. human immunodeficiency virus protease inhibitors, systemically used azole-antimycotic agents, clarithromycin or telithromycin

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX16
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Strong inducers of CYP3A4, e.g. phenytoin, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, rifampicin or St. John’s wort.Other

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX17
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known current alcohol and/or illicit drug abuse that may interfere with the participant’s safety and/or compliance at the discretion of the investigator

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX18
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Women of childbearing potential (women are considered of childbearing potential if they are not surgically sterile or postmenopausal, defined as amenorrhea for > 12 months). Male participants not...

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX19
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Close affiliation with the investigational site or sponsor; e.g. a close relative of the investigator, or a dependent person (e.g. employee or student of the investigational site or the sponsor)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX20
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous (within 30 days or 5 half-lives of the investigational drug, whichever is longer) or concomitant participation in another clinical study with investigational medicinal product(s) or...

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: EX21
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any condition or therapy, which would make the participant unsuitable for the study (e.g. non-compliance) or otherwise vulnerable (e.g. participant in custody by order of an authority or a court)...

studyDesigns.name: Main Study Design
studyDesigns.description: Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind, Parallel Group, Dose-finding Phase 2 Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of BAY2433334 in Patients Following an Acute Non-cardioembolic Ischemic Stroke
studyDesigns.label: Main Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind, Parallel Group, Dose-finding Phase 2 Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of BAY2433334 in Patients Following an Acute Non-cardioembolic Ischemic Stroke

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN01
eligibilityCriteria.label: Participant must be 45 years of age and older at the time of signing the informed consent Type of Participant and Disease Characteristics

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN02
eligibilityCriteria.label: Non-cardioembolic ischemic stroke with

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN03
eligibilityCriteria.label: persistent signs and symptoms of stroke lasting for ≥ 24 hours OR

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN04
eligibilityCriteria.label: acute brain infarction documented by computed tomography (CT) or MRI AND

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN05
eligibilityCriteria.label: with the intention to be treated with antiplatelet therapy during the study conduct

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN06
eligibilityCriteria.label: Imaging of brain (CT or MRI) ruling out hemorrhagic stroke or another pathology that could explain symptoms (e.g. brain tumor, abscess, vascular malformation)

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN07
eligibilityCriteria.label: Severity of index event nearest the time of randomization:

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN08
eligibilityCriteria.label: Part A: minor stroke (defined as NIHSS ≤ 7) can be enrolled

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN09
eligibilityCriteria.label: Part B: participants with minor or moderate stroke and NIHSS ≤ 15 can be enrolled. Participants undergoing thrombolysis or endovascular therapy (mechanical thrombectomy) can be enrolled but at the earliest 24 hours after the intervention

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN10
eligibilityCriteria.label: Randomization within 48 hours after the onset of symptoms of the index event (or after patients were last known to be without symptoms in case of wake-up stroke)

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN11
eligibilityCriteria.label: Ability to conduct an MRI either before randomization or within 72 hours after randomization Informed Consent

eligibilityCriteria.name: IN12
eligibilityCriteria.label: Capable of giving signed informed consent which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the informed consent form (ICF) and in this protocol. Written informed consent has to be signed before any study procedure.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX01
eligibilityCriteria.label: Prior ischemic stroke within last 30 days of index event

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX02
eligibilityCriteria.label: History of atrial fibrillation* or suspicion of cardioembolic source of stroke (*12-lead ECG or documented during cardiac rhythm monitoring)

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX03
eligibilityCriteria.label: Dysphagia with inability to safely swallow study medication at time of randomization

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX04
eligibilityCriteria.label: Contraindication to perform brain MRI (e.g. certain types of aneurysm clips, claustrophobia, patients that cannot lie supine for 30 minutes, patients whose body structure exceeds the restrictions of the local MRI instrument)

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX05
eligibilityCriteria.label: Part A only: thrombolysis or endovascular therapy (mechanical thrombectomy) performed for index event

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX06
eligibilityCriteria.label: Uncontrolled hypertension (systolic blood pressure ≥ 160 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure ≥ 100 mmHg) at randomization

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX07
eligibilityCriteria.label: Active bleeding; known bleeding disorder, history of major bleeding (intracranial, retroperitoneal, intraocular) or clinically significant gastrointestinal bleeding within last 6 months of randomization

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX08
eligibilityCriteria.label: Known significant liver disease (e.g. acute hepatitis, chronic active hepatitis, cirrhosis) or hepatic insufficiency classified as Child-Pugh B or C, or ALT or AST > 2.5 x the upper limit, measured between enrollment and randomization

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX09
eligibilityCriteria.label: Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) < 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 calculated by Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD), determined between enrollment and randomization.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX10
eligibilityCriteria.label: Major surgery during last 30 days or planned major surgery or intervention within study period (e.g. Carotid endarterectomy, CABG)

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX11
eligibilityCriteria.label: Known allergy, intolerance or hypersensitivity to the study intervention (active substance or excipients). Prior/Concomitant Therapy

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX12
eligibilityCriteria.label: Planned use or requirement of full dose and long term anticoagulation therapy during study conduct

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX13
eligibilityCriteria.label: Anticipated need for chronic (more than 4 weeks) therapy with NSAIDs

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX14
eligibilityCriteria.label: Concomitant use of any of the following therapies within 14 days (or at least five halflives of the active substance whatever is longer) before randomization and first study intervention administration:

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX15
eligibilityCriteria.label: Strong inhibitors of cytochrome P450 isoenzyme 3A4 (CYP3A4) e.g. human immunodeficiency virus protease inhibitors, systemically used azole-antimycotic agents, clarithromycin or telithromycin

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX16
eligibilityCriteria.label: Strong inducers of CYP3A4, e.g. phenytoin, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, rifampicin or St. John’s wort.Other

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX17
eligibilityCriteria.label: Known current alcohol and/or illicit drug abuse that may interfere with the participant’s safety and/or compliance at the discretion of the investigator

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX18
eligibilityCriteria.label: Women of childbearing potential (women are considered of childbearing potential if they are not surgically sterile or postmenopausal, defined as amenorrhea for > 12 months). Male participants not willing to use condoms when sexually active with a woman of childbearing potential

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX19
eligibilityCriteria.label: Close affiliation with the investigational site or sponsor; e.g. a close relative of the investigator, or a dependent person (e.g. employee or student of the investigational site or the sponsor)

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX20
eligibilityCriteria.label: Previous (within 30 days or 5 half-lives of the investigational drug, whichever is longer) or concomitant participation in another clinical study with investigational medicinal product(s) or device(s). Registries and observational studies are allowed.

eligibilityCriteria.name: EX21
eligibilityCriteria.label: Any condition or therapy, which would make the participant unsuitable for the study (e.g. non-compliance) or otherwise vulnerable (e.g. participant in custody by order of an authority or a court) or life expectancy < 6 months.

objectives.name: Primary Objective 1
objectives.description: To assess the dose response of 3 different doses of BAY 2433334 compared to placebo in reducing the composite of symptomatic ischemic strokes and covert brain infarcts detected by MRI as well as other cerebro- and cardiovascular endpoints in participants with an acute noncardioembolic ischemic stroke and who are treated with antiplatelet therapy.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: composite of symptomatic ischemic stroke and covert brain infarcts detected by MRI

objectives.name: Primary Objective 2
objectives.description: To evaluate whether the incidence of bleeding is similar for BAY 2433334 compared to placebo in participants with an acute non-cardioembolic ischemic stroke and who are treated with antiplatelet therapy

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: composite of International Society on Thrombosis and Hemostasis (ISTH) major bleeding and clinically relevant non-major (CRNM) bleeding

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 3
objectives.description: To assess the dose response of 3 different doses of BAY 2433334 compared to placebo in reducing the composite of symptomatic ischemic strokes and covert brain infarcts detected by MRI as well as other cerebro- and cardiovascular endpoints in participants with an acute noncardioembolic ischemic stroke and who are treated with antiplatelet therapy.

endpoints.name: Endpoint 1
endpoints.description: composite of symptomatic ischemic stroke and covert brain infarcts detected by MRI, CV death, myocardial infarction and systemic embolism

endpoints.name: Endpoint 3
endpoints.description: covert brain infarcts detected by MRI

endpoints.name: Endpoint 4
endpoints.description: symptomatic ischemic stroke, CV death, myocardial infarction

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 4
objectives.description: to evaluate whether the incidence of bleeding is similar for BAY 2433334 compared to placebo in participants with an acute non-cardioembolic ischemic stroke and who are treated with antiplatelet therapy

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 5
objectives.description: To evaluate whether the incidence of bleeding is similar for BAY 2433334 compared to placebo in participants with an acute non-cardioembolic ischemic stroke and who are treated with antiplatelet therapy

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 6
objectives.description: To explore additional pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic parameters, biomarkers and genetics

endpoints.name: Endpoint 2
endpoints.description: Various biomarkers and genetics may be explored (e.g. diagnostic, safety, PD, monitoring, or potentially predictive biomarkers)

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 7
objectives.description: To further investigate the study intervention (i.e. mode-of-action-related effects and / or safety) and to further investigate pathomechanisms deemed relevant to cardiovascular diseases and associated health problems

endpoints.name: Endpoint 2
endpoints.description: Various biomarkers and genetics may be explored (e.g. diagnostic, safety, PD, monitoring, or potentially predictive biomarkers)

activities.name: Investigational Product Accountability
activities.label: Investigational Product Accountability
activities.description: This collection contains information only on the accountability of a medication to a patient. Information may include the amount of IP used/taken

activities.name: Participant Contact Card
activities.label: Participant Contact Card
activities.description: Patients and participants are given contact cards containing study and investigator information

activities.name: MRI, Brain, Diffusion Weighted Imaging (DWI)
activities.label: MRI, Brain, Diffusion Weighted Imaging (DWI)
activities.description: Diffusion Weighted Imaging (DWI) is a specialized MRI technique that provides unique insights into the microscopic structure of brain tissue by measuring the random movement of water molecules. This technique is particularly useful in diagnosing acute stroke, as it can detect changes in water diffusion within minutes of symptom onset, allowing for rapid intervention. DWI is also valuable in identifying other neurological conditions, such as tumors, infections, and white matter disorders, by revealing patterns of restricted or increased water diffusion.

activities.name: IP Administration - Oral Tablet
activities.label: IP Administration - Oral Tablet
activities.description: A tablet containing medicated materials to be taken by mouth and swallowed.

activities.name: Contact IXRS
activities.label: Contact IXRS
activities.description: Contact IXRS refers to the action of reaching out to or using the Interactive Voice/Web Response System to complete specific tasks related to the trial. For example, study coordinators might contact IXRS to randomize a patient, confirm drug shipment, or manage inventory. It’s a more general term for when a trial site or investigator directly interacts with the system to complete tasks

activities.name: Vital Signs
activities.label: Vital Signs
activities.description: This panel was created to collect the set of vital sign observations that was originally defined by HITSP and called the "Vital Sign Result Value Set" in the C80 Clinical Document and Message Terminology Component (Value Set OID: 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.80.62), but it is not limited for use in that context. This collection includes the standard vital sign measurements (heart and respiratory rate, blood pressure and body temperature) along with measurements for height, weight, head circumference (OFC), and oximetry.

activities.name: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
activities.label: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)

activities.name: Informed Consent, Pharmacogenetic (PGx) Testing
activities.label: Informed Consent, Pharmacogenetic (PGx) Testing
activities.description: Informed Consent for Pharmacogenetic (PGx) Testing involves obtaining permission from a patient to perform genetic tests

activities.name: Thrombin Activatable Fibrinolysis Inhibitor [Units/Vol] by Chromogenic Method
activities.label: Thrombin Activatable Fibrinolysis Inhibitor [Units/Vol] by Chromogenic Method
activities.description: This term was created for, but not limited in use to, the submitter's Roche, STAGO, STACHROM TAFI test kit, using a synthetic chromogenic substrate method.

activities.name: Chemistry Panel (CHEM-20)
activities.label: Chemistry Panel (CHEM-20)
activities.description: The components of this panel were defined by HealthLink British Columbia

activities.name: Coagulation Factor XI Ag [Units/volume] by Immunoassay
activities.label: Coagulation Factor XI Ag [Units/volume] by Immunoassay
activities.description: This assay measures the functional activity of coagulation Factor XI in platelet-poor plasma (PPP). The result is typically reported as a ratio or percentage compared to normal activity levels. Factor XI plays a role in the intrinsic pathway of blood coagulation, and abnormal activity can be associated with bleeding disorders (such as Factor XI deficiency, sometimes referred to as Hemophilia C) or, less commonly, with thrombotic conditions. This test helps clinicians assess clotting function and determine bleeding risk.

activities.name: Thrombin Antithrombin Complex Ag [Mass/Vol]
activities.label: Thrombin Antithrombin Complex Ag [Mass/Vol]
activities.description: antithrombin III binds to thrombin forming a 1:1 complex

activities.name: Pharmacogenetic DNA Analysis Panel
activities.label: Pharmacogenetic DNA Analysis Panel
activities.description: The summary panel for a pharmacogenomic DNA analysis for one or more laboratory tests on a single accession.
